Utilities

DNA Constants

This script contains the DNA constant values (e.g. bp rise)

class mango.utils.DNA_property_constants.BDNA(diameter: float = 2.25, pitch_per_rise: float = 0.34)[source]

Bases: object

diameter: float = 2.25
pitch_per_rise: float = 0.34

Design IO

This script is for reading in / outputting design files. For example, exporting to PLY file to convert a design to a DNA file via DAEDALUS2.

mango.utils.design_io.export_DNA_design(automated_scaffold_executable_path: str, design: ~mango.design_spaces.polyhedral_design_space.PolyhedralSpace, export_path: str, savename_no_extension: str, DNA_geometry=<class 'mango.utils.DNA_property_constants.BDNA'>, scaffold_sequence_filepath: str | None = None, ply_or_obj: str = 'ply', automated_name: str = 'DAEDALUS', vHelix_sim_time=0.0) -> (<class 'int'>, <class 'bool'>)[source]

This is the top level function a user should call which will export a single design using the ATHENA algorithms (i.e., DAEDALUS or TALOS). The export_design_to_ply is called by this function.

Parameters:

  • design – PolyhedralSpace design space that is to be converted to a PLY file

  • automated_scaffold_executable_path – Filepath to automated algorithm (e.g. DAEDALUS2.exe path)

  • export_path – Filepath where to save the DNA design files to

  • savename_no_extension – User defined name to save the design as

  • DNA_geometry – Do not change

  • scaffold_sequence_filepath – Path to sequence file to use, default is M13

  • ply_or_obj – Ply will export a PLY file, obj will export an OBJ file

  • vHelix_sim_time – If using vHelix, this controls how long the sim time should go for. Generally, I would not recommend using any higher than zero and fine-tune the design after the generative process. If you opt to use this simulation during the generative process, be prepared for very lengthy processes (i.e., ~day(s) depending on optimizer hyperparameters).

mango.utils.design_io.export_design_to_obj(design: PolyhedralSpace, savepath: str, savename_no_extension: str)[source]

This function exports a given PolyhedralSpace to a .obj file for the use in a automated scaffold routing algorithm

Parameters:

  • design – PolyhedralSpace design space that is to be converted to a obj file

  • savepath – Filepath where to save the obj file

  • savename_no_extension – Filename of the obj file to use

Returns:

Directory path of where the file was saved

mango.utils.design_io.export_design_to_ply(design: PolyhedralSpace, savepath: str, savename_no_extension: str)[source]

This function exports a given PolyhedralSpace to a .ply file for the use in a automated scaffold routing algorithm

Parameters:

  • design – PolyhedralSpace design space that is to be converted to a PLY file

  • savepath – Filepath where to save the ply file

  • savename_no_extension – Filename of the ply file to use

Returns:

Directory path of where the file was saved

mango.utils.design_io.mass_design_export(automated_scaffold_executable_path: str, export_path: str, aj1_filepath: str, scaffold_sequence_filepath: str, DNA_geometry=<class 'mango.utils.DNA_property_constants.BDNA'>, ply_or_obj: str = 'ply')[source]

This is the top level function a user should call which will export a single design. The export_design_to_ply is called by this function.

Parameters:

  • aj1_filepath – Filepath to .aj1 file that was exported from a multi-objective optimization process

  • automated_scaffold_executable_path – Filepath to automated algorithm (e.g. DAEDALUS2.exe path)

  • export_path – Filepath where to save the DNA design files to

  • DNA_geometry – Do not change

  • scaffold_sequence_filepath – Path to sequence file to use, default is M13
